content.description: Sit start at sharp crimp and a sloper. Bump to another sharp edge then pull to slopers at the lip. Move up slopers until you can mantle onto the top.
content.location: This is on a small boulder 100 feet or so beyond the Sleeping Giant on the other side of a small rise. This climb is on the side of the boulder facing back towards Sleeping Giant.

content.description: Climb the less-than-vertical face and arete on the left side of the Giant's Foot. Smear up the face along the arete to a great horizontal edge. Get your feet up and go to the lip. Don't mess up, the landing is terrible.
content.location: Climb the less-than-vertical face and arete on the left side of the Giant's Foot.

content.description: Sit start the great undercling jug. Crank to an ok hold on the lip and then move into the big jug. Get your feet up and pull to the top.
content.location: Just to the left of the cave there's an obvious right-facing flake crack under a short overhang.

content.description: Climbs the middle of the "giants belly". Use ok sidepulls to get your feet up and reach for a jug in the horizontal crack. Pull to the juggy lip and mantle.
content.location: Climbs right up the middle of the central boulder here.

content.description: Climbs sloping shelves up the side of the "giant's feet".
content.location: On the right side of the rectangular tower of the Giant's Foot.

content.description: Start low and move through crimp rails to the triangular tooth/horn. Move to the lip and mantle onto the top.
content.location: This is on a small boulder 100 feet or so beyond the Sleeping Giant on the other side of a small rise. This climb is on the side of the boulder facing towards the swamp.

content.description: An interesting one-move-wonder. Sit start the overhang at the undercling flake/crack. Handjam and crank to the lip. Mantle awkwardly onto the top.
content.location: This is on a small boulder 100 feet or so beyond the Sleeping Giant on the other side of a small rise. This climb is on the shortest side of the boulder facing back towards the swamp. Look for the overhang.

content.description: Climbs the tallest feature here (the "giants feet"). Ascend the gently overhanging face via a layback crack to a finger crack to a juggy ledge. Pull to the lip and mantle onto the sloping summit. Easy climbing to a committing topout!
A solitary cluster of boulders with a striking, tall rectangular tower. There are three boulders here clumped together in a the rough shape of a "giant". The "head" is a really cool cave feature.
